Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 26 February, 2022 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on Rally Sweden, 2022. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

the stage winner. 1.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 1.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times the stage winner. 2.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times places to take the overall lead of the rally recording a time of 759.6s. ROV was in second place on stage, with a time of 762.1s . SOL took third place on stage, 3.8s behind the stage winner . TÄN took fourth on stage, 5.7s behind stage winner LAP in a time of 765.3s and dropped three places to lose the overall lead, falling back to fourth overall. EVA was in fifth on stage, with a time of 765.5s and moved up one place to fifth overall, just 0.2s off TÄN. NEU was in sixth on stage, 8.8s behind LAP in a time of 768.4s dropped two places to sixth overall. KAT was in seventh place on stage, with a time of 777.5s and moved up one place to seventh overall. GRE was in eighth position on stage, 4.9s further back behind KAT and moved up one place to eighth overall. FOU took ninth on stage, 26.8s behind the stage winner and moved up one place to ninth overall. BRE was in fortieth place on stage dropped three places to tenth overall, with a time of 1359.6s, well back on FOU, who was 413.4s quicker. 2.3 Driver Report, SS2 - ROV ROV was in second place on stage, with a time of 762.1s . ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 3.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times NEU was in second on stage, 0.7s behind ROV and moved up four places to second overall, just 0.7s off ROV. EVA was in third on stage, 3.8s further back behind NEU and moved up one place to fourth overall. SOL was in fourth place on stage, with a time of 495.2s . KAT was in fifth position on stage, with a time of 495.7s, just 0.5s off SOL. TÄN was in sixth on stage, with a time of 497.7s dropped one place to fifth overall. GRE was in seventh on stage, 14.1s behind stage winner ROV . LAP was in eighth position on stage, with a time of 501.7s and dropped five places to lose the overall lead, falling back to sixth overall and just 0.9s further back behind GRE. FOU took ninth position on stage, with a time of 504.7s . BRE was in fortieth on stage, 600.0s behind ROV, well back on FOU, who was 406.6s faster. 3.3 Driver Report, SS3 - ROV ROV recorded the stage win and picked up one place to gain the overall lead with a time of 486.7s. ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 4.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Stage report for SS4: EVA took the stage and picked up three places to gain the overall lead of the rally marking a time of 500.0s. LAP was in second position on stage, 1.7s behind EVA and moved up three places to third overall. SOL was in third on stage, 2.4s behind EVA and moved up one place to second overall and just 0.7s further back behind LAP. TÄN took fourth position on stage, 2.6s behind EVA in a time of 502.6s, just 0.2s off SOL. FOU was in fifth place on stage, 6.7s behind the stage winner . NEU was in sixth on stage, 2.3s further back behind FOU dropped four places to sixth overall. GRE was in seventh place on stage, 7.0s further back behind NEU and moved up one place to seventh overall. ROV took eighth on stage, with a time of 516.3s and dropped three places to lose the overall lead, falling back to fourth overall, just 0.3s off GRE. KAT took twenty-first on stage, with a time of 539.0s dropped one place to eighth overall, just 0.5s off ROV. BRE took thirty-ninth on stage, 600.0s behind the stage winner, well back on KAT, who was 450.0s faster. 4.3 Driver Report, SS4 - ROV ROV took eighth on stage, with a time of 516.3s and dropped three places to lose the overall lead, falling back to fourth overall, just 0.3s off GRE. stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 6.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times KAT took fourth position on stage, 2.3s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 383.5s , just 0.6s behind ROV. TÄN took fifth on stage, with a time of 383.8s, just 0.3s off KAT. NEU took sixth on stage, with a time of 387.9s and dropped one place to lose the overall lead, falling back to second overall. BRE was in seventh on stage, 8.7s behind EVA . SOL took eighth on stage, 10.2s behind stage winner EVA . GRE took ninth position on stage, 13.1s behind the stage winner in a time of 394.3s . FOU took tenth on stage, with a time of 401.8s . 8.3 Driver Report, SS8 - ROV ROV took third on stage, with a time of 382.9s and picked up one place to gain the overall lead of the rally. the stage winner. 9.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 9.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 11.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 12.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 13.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times
